clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Glucose Tolerance Testing After Gestational Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Glucose Tolerance Testing After Gestational Diabetes

collaborator.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observation study of women with gestational diabetes. Subjects recruited undergo immediate postpartum diabetic screening prior to discharge. Post-partum screening for overt diabetes is repeated 6-12 weeks postpartum. The outcome of interest is the utility of an immediate post partum screen for overt diabetes compared to a traditional 6 week test.

primary_outcome.measure: Primary outcome: sensitivity of immediate post partum screen
primary_outcome.description: 2 hour fasting 75g OGTT immediately post partum. This is compared to a traditional 6 week post partum 75g OGTT for the sensitivity, positive and negative predictive value of the immediate post partum test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 time points: antepatum, immediate postpartum, 6 weeks post partum
secondary_outcome.description: A small sub-cohort of women will undergo an additional 2 hour fasting 75g OGTT in the third trimester with measurements of insulin, cytokines, lipids.

arm_group.description: Primary cohort is women with diagnosis of gestational diabetes without evidence of overt diabetes

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum for measurements of insulin, markers of inflammation

study_pop.textblock: Primary cohort is obtained from a pregnant population at two academic medical centers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy
- Gestational diabetes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Multiple gestations
- pre-pregnancy diabetes
